p: Population mobility is also a key driver of the HIV epidemic [ 5] and is linked to a higher incidence of infection [ 6]. Although attention in recent years has focused on migrants from high-prevalence countries with generalized epidemics, there is evidence that in Europe, specific migrant groups from other regions with more concentrated epidemics, such as gay, bisexual, and other men who have sex with men (GBMSM) from Latin America and Western Europe, are also highly vulnerable to HIV infection [ 7].
